title: I strongly dislike the state of dragons right now.
body: It feels like, if the enemy team gets three infernals, it is an automatic win. The reason this is so frustrating, is that while I understand they SHOULDNT get three, sometimes it is too hard to contest. I feel like infernal should be one of those dragons that is REALLY good at helping a lesser team comp, do better, but rather it is, a roflstomping team comp that is maximizing it so that they just stomp even harder, personally ive never been a fan of these new dragons, but I feel like it shouldn't really be rng, as in like there shouldn't be a possibility to get three infernals (+24% ap and ad) like what? That's just throwing free stats to champions who are already doing well in their lane, I don't know, I just feel like it shouldn't be so readily available to snowball even harder

Infernal looks good on paper, but look at it like this. Infernal drag boosts % AP and % AD. but if you are using a non auto attack based champion, then most of your AP and AD are only relevant in your skills.

lets say your Q has a 60% ratio, your W no scaling, your E a 60% ratio, and your ult a 60%+60% ratio. then that means You will only get 60% of the infernal drags buff on your Q and your E, no effect whatsoever on your W, and 120% of the dragons effect on the ultimate. That's it.

some champions have scalings as low as 20 and 40% in some areas while other champions may have their damage scale on things like health and mana pool ( ). making it so that blue boy is only getting half benefit from red drake as only half his AP scaling is tuned around him having actual AP.

The red drag is a trap in that everyone seems to THINK that the %BOOST it gives to stats is how much every champions damage goes up, but it isn't. since there are little to no kits in all of league of legends that 100% scaling anywhere outside of their ultimates. meaning other than auto attack based champs who can use the AD boost for better autos, everyone has to rely only scaling giving them a watered down buff that isn't nearly as effective as they thought it was.

So i repeat. infernal drag IS NOT the strongest dragon right now.

You have a logical error in your calculation.

Ignoring base damages, an 8% increase to a scaling stat (be it AP or AD) will result in the damage from the scaling being increased by 8%.

For example, take someone with 100 AP and a 1.0 and 0.5 AP ratio on an ability with no base damage:

The damage of the 1.0 AP ability goes from 100 to 108, an 8% increase.
The damage of the 0.5 AP ability goes from 50 to 54, which is also an 8% increase.

Such an ability with no base damage and 1.0 scaling is your regular auto-attack. Thus, 8% increased AD equals 8% increased damage from auto-attacks.

It gets muddier when base damages are included. Let's say our ability deals 100 base damage.

The damage of the 1.0 AP ability goes from 200 to 208, a 4% increase.
The damage of the 0.5 AP ability goes from 150 to 154, which is a 2.7% increase.

The issue with dragons is that some are so much better than others.

Oh, you get 3 early infernals when you're winning? Can't possibly throw that game.
Oh, you get 3 early mountains when you're winning? Going to be pretty tough to throw that game.

Oh, you get 3 ocean drakes when you're winning? Laning phase will be a breeze but come late game they're only a minor advantage, could easily throw.
Oh, you get 3 cloud drakes when you're winning? You may take a couple extra towers but after that they'll be nearly worthless and there's nothing to stop you throwing. 

Why is it that one game I'm winning and get clouds/oceans so it's hard to close out despite playing well, then the next game I'm losing and the enemy team gets infernals and despite making lots of mistakes we still can't come back on them - is beyond me. There's no need for this extra luck in the game.

It's like, we've seen pro games in seasons 4/5 where a team goes too heavy on the early game power and then gets outscaled and loses because of it. What if the Drake cycled through each one every minute?  180 seconds of not being in combat and it changes into another type.  Something that shows a glowing dragon pit that increases over 5-10 seconds so we can see the change coming if we have sight of the pit, otherwise just updates the HUD with the new type.  And like the jungle respawn timers it can show a timer only if you saw it change or leave combat.

This would allow for the team to pick what drake they want, give some pressure to rush to the right one and give some balance to the drake.  I get that it means easy stacks for the same type, but add something that drake deals 7.5% more damage and receives 7.5% less damage per stack of the same element.  So first drake would have no change, but for your second mountain drake you would take 7.5% more damage and deal 7.5% less for your team, and a third drake would deal 15% more damage and take 15% less for your team, while the other team with no mountain drakes would receive no penalty (also makes it easier for a team without that drake to steal the kill).  Any kill after the 3rd of one type of drake gives gold and exp but no buff.

To make it more interesting I think it should start with a random drake, then randomly cycle through until all 4 have shown up before restarting the cycle, again randomly.  So using numbers to represent the drakes it could be 1 > 3 > 4 > 2 > 3 > 1 > 2 > 4.  Or if they really want to keep it random then make it a random cycle that will not pick the current or previous drake, but I like my idea more.  This would make it somewhat random and somewhat predictable, knowing that if the first drake is an infernal and it changes then you can't get back to the infernal for a minimum of 9 minutes.  Although it also means that a champion could run up and hit the drake to make it not change, so if you know that infernal is next (mountain, cloud and ocean drakes have already shown) and it would benefit the enemy more than your team you could delay the change to prevent the enemy from getting it.

I think it would add a lot of fun and tactical planning while not really having to make changes to the drake's buffs.
